intro: Mycaranthes brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stalked starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, with a compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
